trans-unit.source: SSO for On Prem IWA Apps Using KCD with Application Proxy
trans-unit.target: SSO for On Prem IWA Apps Using KCD with Application Proxy

trans-unit.source: Covers how to get up and running with Azure AD Application Proxy.
trans-unit.target: Covers how to get up and running with Azure AD Application Proxy.

trans-unit.source: You can enable Single Sign On (SSO) to your applications using Integrated Windows Authentication (IWA) by giving Application Proxy Connectors permission in Active Directory to impersonate users and send and receive tokens on their behalf.
trans-unit.target: You can enable Single Sign On (SSO) to your applications using Integrated Windows Authentication (IWA) by giving Application Proxy Connectors permission in Active Directory to impersonate users and send and receive tokens on their behalf.

trans-unit.source: Application Proxy is a feature that is available only if you upgraded to the Premium or Basic edition of Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Application Proxy is a feature that is available only if you upgraded to the Premium or Basic edition of Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Azure Active Directory editions</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Azure Active Directory editions</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Microsoft AAD authentication flow diagram</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Microsoft AAD authentication flow diagram</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This diagram explains the flow when a user attempts to access an on-prem application that uses IWA.
trans-unit.target: This diagram explains the flow when a user attempts to access an on-prem application that uses IWA.

trans-unit.source: The general flow is:
trans-unit.target: The general flow is:

trans-unit.source: The user enters the URL to access the on-prem application through Application Proxy.
trans-unit.target: The user enters the URL to access the on-prem application through Application Proxy.

trans-unit.source: Application Proxy redirects the request to Azure AD authentication services to preauthenticate.
trans-unit.target: Application Proxy redirects the request to Azure AD authentication services to preauthenticate.

trans-unit.source: At this point, Azure AD applies any applicable authentication and authorization policies, such as multifactor authentication.
trans-unit.target: At this point, Azure AD applies any applicable authentication and authorization policies, such as multifactor authentication.

trans-unit.source: If the user is validated, Azure AD creates a token and sends it to the user.
trans-unit.target: If the user is validated, Azure AD creates a token and sends it to the user.

trans-unit.source: The user passes the token to Application Proxy.
trans-unit.target: The user passes the token to Application Proxy.

trans-unit.source: Application Proxy validates the token and retrieves the User Principal Name (UPN) from it, and then sends the request, the UPN, and the Service Principal Name (SPN) to the Connector through a dually authenticated secure channel.
trans-unit.target: Application Proxy validates the token and retrieves the User Principal Name (UPN) from it, and then sends the request, the UPN, and the Service Principal Name (SPN) to the Connector through a dually authenticated secure channel.

trans-unit.source: The Connector performs Kerberos Constrained Delegation (KCD) negotiation with the on-prem AD, impersonating the user to get a Kerberos token to the application.
trans-unit.target: The Connector performs Kerberos Constrained Delegation (KCD) negotiation with the on-prem AD, impersonating the user to get a Kerberos token to the application.

trans-unit.source: Active Directory sends the Kerberos token for the application to the Connector.
trans-unit.target: Active Directory sends the Kerberos token for the application to the Connector.

trans-unit.source: The Connector sends the original request to the application server, using the Kerberos token it received from AD.
trans-unit.target: The Connector sends the original request to the application server, using the Kerberos token it received from AD.

trans-unit.source: The application sends the response to the Connector which is then returned to the Application Proxy service and finally to the user.
trans-unit.target: The application sends the response to the Connector which is then returned to the Application Proxy service and finally to the user.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that your apps, such as your SharePoint Web apps, are set to use Integrated Windows Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that your apps, such as your SharePoint Web apps, are set to use Integrated Windows Authentication.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <linkText>Enable Support for Kerberos Authentication</linkText><title></title>, or for SharePoint see <linkText>Plan for Kerberos authentication in SharePoint 2013</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <linkText>Enable Support for Kerberos Authentication</linkText><title></title>, or for SharePoint see <linkText>Plan for Kerberos authentication in SharePoint 2013</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create Service Principal Names for your applications.
trans-unit.target: Create Service Principal Names for your applications.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the server running the Connector and the server running the app you are publishing are domain joined and part of the same domain.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the server running the Connector and the server running the app you are publishing are domain joined and part of the same domain.

trans-unit.source: For more information on domain join, see <linkText>Join a Computer to a Domain</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on domain join, see <linkText>Join a Computer to a Domain</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Active Directory configuration varies, depending on whether your Application Proxy Connector and the published server are in the same domain or not.
trans-unit.target: The Active Directory configuration varies, depending on whether your Application Proxy Connector and the published server are in the same domain or not.

trans-unit.source: In Active Directory, go to Tools > Users and Computers.
trans-unit.target: In Active Directory, go to Tools > Users and Computers.

trans-unit.source: Select the server running the Connector.
trans-unit.target: Select the server running the Connector.

trans-unit.source: Right click and select Properties > Delegation.
trans-unit.target: Right click and select Properties > Delegation.

trans-unit.source: Select Trust this computer for delegation to specified services only and under Services to which this account can present delegated credentials, add the value for the Service Principal Name (SPN) identity of the application server.
trans-unit.target: Select Trust this computer for delegation to specified services only and under Services to which this account can present delegated credentials, add the value for the Service Principal Name (SPN) identity of the application server.

trans-unit.source: This enables the Application Proxy Connector to impersonate users in AD against the applications defined in the list.
trans-unit.target: This enables the Application Proxy Connector to impersonate users in AD against the applications defined in the list.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connector-SVR Properties window screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connector-SVR Properties window screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For a list of prerequisites for working with KCD across domains, see <linkText>Kerberos Constrained Delegation across domains</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of prerequisites for working with KCD across domains, see <linkText>Kerberos Constrained Delegation across domains</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In Windows 2012 R2, use the principalsallowedtodelegateto property on the Connector server to enable the Application Proxy to delegate for the Connector server, where the published server is sharepointserviceaccount and the delegating server is connectormachineaccount.
trans-unit.target: In Windows 2012 R2, use the principalsallowedtodelegateto property on the Connector server to enable the Application Proxy to delegate for the Connector server, where the published server is sharepointserviceaccount and the delegating server is connectormachineaccount.

trans-unit.source: sharepointserviceaccount can be the SPS machine account or a service account under which the SPS app pool is running.
trans-unit.target: sharepointserviceaccount can be the SPS machine account or a service account under which the SPS app pool is running.

trans-unit.source: Publish your application according to the instructions described in <linkText>Publish applications with Application Proxy</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Publish your application according to the instructions described in <linkText>Publish applications with Application Proxy</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to select Azure Active Directory as the Preauthentication Method.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to select Azure Active Directory as the Preauthentication Method.

trans-unit.source: After your application appears in the list of applications, select it and click Configure.
trans-unit.target: After your application appears in the list of applications, select it and click Configure.

trans-unit.source: Under Properties, set Internal Authentication Method to Integrated Windows Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Under Properties, set Internal Authentication Method to Integrated Windows Authentication.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Advanced Application Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Advanced Application Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the Internal Application SPN of the application server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Internal Application SPN of the application server.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the SPN for our published application is http/lob.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the SPN for our published application is http/lob.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: The UPNs in Azure Active Directory must be identical to the UPNs in your on-premises Active Directory in order for preauthentication to work.
trans-unit.target: The UPNs in Azure Active Directory must be identical to the UPNs in your on-premises Active Directory in order for preauthentication to work.

trans-unit.source: Make sure your Azure Active Directory is synchronized with your on-premises Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Make sure your Azure Active Directory is synchronized with your on-premises Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Internal Authentication Method
trans-unit.target: Internal Authentication Method

trans-unit.source:
If you use Azure AD for preauthentication, you can set an internal authentication method to enable your users to benefit from single-sign on (SSO) to this application.

Select Integrated Windows Authentication (IWA) if your application uses IWA and you can configure Kerberos Constrained Delegation (KCD) to enable SSO for this application. Applications that use IWA must be configured using KCD, otherwise Application Proxy will not be able to publish these applications.

Select None if your application does not use IWA.
trans-unit.target:
If you use Azure AD for preauthentication, you can set an internal authentication method to enable your users to benefit from single-sign on (SSO) to this application.

Select Integrated Windows Authentication (IWA) if your application uses IWA and you can configure Kerberos Constrained Delegation (KCD) to enable SSO for this application. Applications that use IWA must be configured using KCD, otherwise Application Proxy will not be able to publish these applications.

Select None if your application does not use IWA.

trans-unit.source: Internal Application SPN
trans-unit.target: Internal Application SPN

trans-unit.source: This is the Service-Principal-Name (SPN) of the internal application as configured in the on-prem Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: This is the Service-Principal-Name (SPN) of the internal application as configured in the on-prem Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: The SPN is used by the Application Proxy Connector to fetch Kerberos tokens for the application using KCD.
trans-unit.target: The SPN is used by the Application Proxy Connector to fetch Kerberos tokens for the application using KCD.
